section.title: Description
section.p: This class records an observation regarding the usual occupation of a person, and what industries the person has worked in. This information is needed primarily for occupation safety and workplace-related illness tracking purposes. Therefore, while such information might be attributable to any Person, we have linked this class with the Patient class rather than the Person class.

stentry.p: Indicates the kind of industry in which the Person normally works; generally this will be the industry in which the Person has longest worked.
Indicates the kind of work that the Person normally performs; generally this will be the occupation in which the Person has longest held.
"A value that qualifies the classification of 'kind-of-work' based upon a recognized industry or jurisdictional standard." - HL7 Version 3 RIM.

Amount of employment – in years associated with usual industry/occupation (e.g., "how long have you worked in your usual industry - such as coal mining"). Added for Public Health Reporting Initiative, 10/12/2012.
